website_summaries.verdict: This inexpensive, lightweight backpack works well with dogs of all sizes.
pros: Constructed with mesh material for cooling and air circulation
Made for small, medium, and large dogs
cons: Not the best option for long-distance hikes

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable pack that works great as a harness too.
customer_reviews.text: Really fits a big dog. Caesar weighs 165 lbs. It didn’t leave much room for adjustment, but it fit well. It worked for letting him carry his own water (ziplock freezer bags). He also carried his collapsible bowl and packed out his own poop. He was comfortable with it and gets exited when he sees it because he knows it’s hiking time.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Plastic clasps don’t hold
customer_reviews.text: I was not satisfied with this purchase. It seemed like a good quality hiking harness until I put it on my dog. As soon as my dog saw a squirrel and pulled the leash to go after it, the plastic clasps gave loose and he got away from me. I had to go chase him as we were out on a walk. This may be a good harness for a low energy dog, but for one that excites easily, I would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Love this pack, good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Got a SM/MD for my 30lb dog. Adjusted the straps and it fits him perfectly. The compartments are big enough for his water bottle, food, and food containers.
customer_reviews.author: Rae

customer_reviews.title: Now my pup can carry his own weight around!
customer_reviews.text: Got tired of carrying water for Hobbes, so this was the perfect solution! He got used to it very quickly, and it can easily hold 2-3 16.9oz plastic water bottles on each side. Might even be able to fit 4 in each "saddle-bag". The metal ring near the handle works great to tether to a leash, it's held in place if my dog tugs to chase the occasional rabbit or squirrel. Just make sure the bags are weighed down equally and this thing will do the trick!
customer_reviews.author: Rhett Bushman

customer_reviews.title: It's been great so far
customer_reviews.text: We have only used his back pack for about a 2 hr trail walk. It's been great so far! He feels important and the fit is great. It doesn't restrict his movement a bit! He ran, jumped, walked, and swam with it! He carried my keys, phone, an apple, a water bottle, and treats in his two pockets and did great. I ordered at Medium size for my dog. The adjustable straps made it easy to fit him.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Fritz

customer_reviews.title: My first Amazon return
customer_reviews.text: Sadly my first Amazon return. I really liked this backpack at first. It fit my dog really well, she didn't mind wearing it, and it looks nice, but it ripped in several places after just a few uses. I put a few treats, a collapsible water dish and baggies in the pockets and the bottom of one pocket ripped open. I attached the leash to the D ring to walk her, and it's starting to rip there as well even though she is not a heavy puller. If this wear had been after a year of use, I would be OK with keeping it and possibly buy another, but not after just a few uses. This is unacceptably low quality.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: Built tough
customer_reviews.text: It was a little tricky getting on and fit was not perfect but with some adjustments and tightening my pup looks great in his new pack. And has loads of carrying space. Wish there was a color option for this item but still love the look.
customer_reviews.author: Freddie Boss

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. The strap that goes around the waist of dog was ample long. I had to cut it since my dog has a narrow body. I liked the little narrow pockets on the outside of the bigger pouches.
customer_reviews.author: Hijuan

customer_reviews.title: Great little pack!
customer_reviews.text: Great little pack! Not a ton of storage space but perfect for carrying a few items on a day trip. If your dogs run through the brush in the woods the material isn't the thickest so it may tear if it gets caught on something, if they stay on trail it's fine. Stays evenly placed when similar weights on either side are added. Doesn't rub or chafe which was a concern of mine since she has sensitive skin. Very nice bright colors for easy visibility. You can't beat it for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for border collie
customer_reviews.text: Really nice pack for border collies. I got a medium for a 55 pound female and 45 pound male full grown border collie.Creates no mobility issues.
customer_reviews.author: Adam P.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: It slides
customer_reviews.text: So I got this for my husky because his trainer suggested to get him a backpack. I like the large storage pockets and the fact that it has a handle. What I don't like is that after being adjusted to size it doesn't stay tightened. The parts that adjusts the backpack to size comes loose easily and then it slides all over leaving no faith in it actually working for him. He has other harnesses so this is his last option only in emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Great dog backpack
customer_reviews.text: I bought this dog backpack for our approximately 40 pound Border Collie. It fits him super well and has a small storage capacity. I was able to fit a waterbottle for him in one side of it and other stuff in the other side. It is water resistant, but after prolonged exposure it does begin to seep into the insides. I love that it has a handle on it, our dog decided to slide down a mountain, so it made it easy to grab him when he got close enough coming back up and pull him to full safety.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Wolcott

customer_reviews.title: Broke 1/2 mile into our first hike!!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this pack. It broke a 1/2 mile into our hike. First hike with a rescue that I’ve had for 5 weeks and the ring where the leash attaches broke, so he was loose in the Shenandoah National Park. Oh, and it happened 10 minutes after we’d seen a bear cross the trail 500 feet ahead of us. Not good. Fortunately my boy has no desire to hunt and only wants to be with me so he came right back to me. Sending this pack back immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Sizing Is Tricky
customer_reviews.text: I do like this dog backpack, which is why I gave it four stars. The sizing for my dog has been tough though. My dog is roughly 27 pounds and a red healer/boarder collie mix. Loves to hike. The backpack itself is sturdy, has sufficient space for water, water dish, treats etc. He actually likes to wear it. I got the medium size as the small seemed too small. Unfortunately I have had to tighten down the straps quite a bit. I think as a result, the backpack wants to rotate to one side. I have to very careful with the weight distribution. Maybe this is true for all dog backpacks, but certainly is the case here.
customer_reviews.author: J. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Runs small?
customer_reviews.text: Medium was too small for my dog. Returning. I have an Australian Shepherd, 3.5 years old, 55lbs. My dog is the same breed as the brown spotty one pictured on the tag. He should fit into a medium size backpack, but he does not. He is fit and runs 20 miles/week, so chubbiness is not a factor. Straps are extended to the max to clip under his belly. Straps dig into his armpits and lower rib cage when he walks. Pockets sit too high, almost on his neck Straps are rather wide, but seem sturdy. Pockets are made of good quality fabric and can be extended to hold more things. .
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for long walks or hikes!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for as something to tire my young schnauzer mix as he has boundless energy. He feels more focused on his walks and when the backpack comes on he knows it’s fine time for a good walk. The size is perfect on him and fits him well. I keep the straps a little loose on him for a more comfy fit and he’s never had any issue with it despite never having worn anything. Now when he sees his backpack he walks his head right into it so I can strap him in!
customer_reviews.author: KimberlyIvette

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: Look at the picture carefully and try to imagine how you would put this on your dog. It doesn't over and then snap into place; it must have the front foot placed into its opening before slipping it over the head and then snapping it into place. The material is not heavyweight; the stitching as well.
customer_reviews.author: gZaller

customer_reviews.title: Does lean to one side
customer_reviews.text: I’m giving this review 5 stars because I really do love this backpack and the review video another person did was super cute! Unfortunately though if you don’t pack your weight JUST right, it will slip to one side :/ which is super unfortunate because that means I have to stop every couple of steps and readjust it. I frequently take my dogs on hikes and trail rides with my horses and wanted to be able to carry water without it being stuck to me, I don’t think I’ll be able to use this though without having to stop and readjust every so often
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: So I bought two of these for my dogs, although I measured as instructed, the wiast strap did not fit, for some reason Amazon decided to charge me for return shipping. Today I tried the other on moy other dog, he like to explore in the forsest as we walk, he caught up to me and one of the straps already broke. I really wanted to like these, they are light and have nice features but they are not durable. Lets face it much of the items we buy here are cheap made in China not quality. Sometimes you do get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn O'Donnell

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this for your pets!
customer_reviews.text: This was a terrible back pack. We bought this for our 75lb lab. The backpack didn't stay in place and kept sliding to either side. We had bought this for our pup to carry his stuff during a hike. After the hike, we noticed the straps of the back pack ripped off the hair on his chest and his skin is super raw. I do not recommend this back pack to any pet owners.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Cupo

customer_reviews.title: Huge Pockets
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my SD Tabasco for a vacation to Michigan; he had to carry his own toys/food/snacks since my bag was already full and I wasn't paying extra. Fit his stuff and more with no complaint. Had to add stitches around the middle to make it fit him right but overall great little pack.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Lost

customer_reviews.title: Cool and cute backpack
customer_reviews.text: I bought the size SM\MD for my boy. At first he had his tail in between his legs, he wasn't comfortable and didn't want to sit. We went out for a walk and once off leash he was himself. I like the color and the style but it fits my dog a lil snug at the tummy. It was my fault, I misread the pounds, my boy is 59\60 so its a tiny bit snug however he was fine with it. I'll attach pics for those who wonder (If I find out how). Aussie\Husky. Overall I like this backpack and think its great and the pockets are pretty nice.
customer_reviews.author: CaliChick310

customer_reviews.title: Zipper CONSTANTLY gets stuck
customer_reviews.text: Great for holding water bottles and fit my dog nicely. My issue is the zipper gets stuck EVERY TIME I try to zip up the packs and that got irritating really quick. It’s not visibly stuck on the inner fabric or anything, so I have no idea what is causing this. Edit: lowering the rating because we can’t use this anymore. The zipper broke on the THIRD use and will not go past a certain point no matter what. Still no visible blockage or known reason why it’s stuck. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: Measure your dog🐕🐾🐾
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 2- 6 months Border Collies.. Best Ever!!! Each carry their own water bottle and collapsible water dish plus snacks. There's even bottom compartments I put my phone or my own water and snacks. Best purchase I ever made now going to state parks are more pleasurable. Thank you Btw..excellent construction and materials ☆☆☆☆☆
customer_reviews.author: Jane M.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for light use
customer_reviews.text: Using the pack now for 6 months - no issues. I use this on Cody everyday for the morning road walk (@1 mile) and on the weekends for woods & mountain trail. No issues at all with the construction. For the road walk, I just use 'ballast' for weight so that never changes. On the trail though, the pack is a little load sensitive if the weight differs greatly from left to right. As long as you can rebalance - no problem. It's a great value and the color is pretty visible.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Really useful, good enough for the money
customer_reviews.text: It serves its purpose well, and it's cheap. I have it for a large pit bull. the handle on the back is great. Overall, I like it, but it's clearly not too well made. This is great for someone who uses it with 6lb of weight in it, daily for 30 minute walks, and sometimes several hour weekend hikes. If you want something very sturdy that will last and not rip with heavy use (frequent long or strenuous hikes, etc.) you may want to invest in a more expensive, higher quality pack. As it's not too well made, I don't advise attaching the leash to the clip if your dog pulls as the threading will likely break.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley

customer_reviews.title: Strap broke pack &!wouldn’t stay in place
customer_reviews.text: Bought this pack since now that my dog is old enough and big enough to carry items I wanted him to carry his gear. There wasn’t much in this pack. A small amount of dog treats, a small bottle of water and a collapsible bowl. The other side had a snack for me. I had left his other harness on since this was not recommended to have the leash attached to. We hadn’t walked a quarter mile and the buckle slipped. I tied it on the strap but I should have just left it in the car. It kept shifting around and my dog was getting annoyed. Not satisfied at all with this pack.
customer_reviews.author: nyassa

customer_reviews.title: Hard to adjust and don't fit right
customer_reviews.text: I bought two bags for my two Australian Shepards. The bags have great storage but are difficult to adjust to the dog's body. I measured my dogs as recommended and bought the size appropriate for their measurements. I have adjusted them 100 different ways but both still slip to one side when they are wearing them and walking. I watched a couple videos of others using them and showing how to adjust them but it just doesn't work for my dogs. I've stopped using them and have switched back to their harnesses. Which means I'm the pack mule again until I can find a suitable backpack for them. Money wasted.
customer_reviews.author: SlM76

customer_reviews.title: Straps are a nuisance. Decent amount of storage for ...
customer_reviews.text: Straps are a nuisance. Decent amount of storage for things. Several little side compartments on bag. Upon using the backpack for first time, one is bound to spend some time adjusting the straps on their dog. Within 20 minutes of doing so while hiking with my dog the straps became tangled/stuck. I had to pull apart all the straps & re-weave them, before re-adjusting the backpack. It took about 30minutes to fix it before it was secure again. Otherwise the backpack holds a decent amount, I put a water bottle on each side & a collapsible bowl in the backpack. With additional room in each side if needed. I got a Large for my 70lbs dog.
customer_reviews.author: Jesska

customer_reviews.title: Lots of pocket space, looks cute on
customer_reviews.text: I loved it. My dog did not. He’s a pretty quiet dog, never barks and only whines in extreme circumstances. This backpack as cute as is was made him cry. We did get compliments on it but ended up taking it off because he was unhappy. It does have a lot of space to put things. We had a small dog water bottle, my keys and phone, poop bags, dog treats, and epipens with a lot of room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: Flutter

customer_reviews.title: Good bag for a dog.
customer_reviews.text: Good backpag for a dog. Fits larger dogs fine. Mine is 90 lbs, and its a good fit for him. When you put bottle of water - bag looks kinda bulky, like wings, but stays on, does not swind to sides, and dog does not seem to be bothered by it. I like the strap that goes on the bottom from head to tail, it hold the bag from swinging to sides on both ends. Material feels strong and there is a room for adjustements in length and width. Just dont use it as a harness. Good bag for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Just what we wanted!
customer_reviews.text: Fits our 47 lb Aussie perfectly! We got the medium. Very nice pack, we have been out for two hikes with it on. She is able to move freely, but pack stays in place. She even rolled a few times with it on! This is not meant to clip a leash to, esp if you have a strong puller. Keep leash clipped to collar. Pack is good for carrying, poop bags, a water bottle, treats etc.
customer_reviews.author: Laura J

customer_reviews.title: Good dog backpack for hiking
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for a way to pack my dog's food and colapsi let water bowl while hiking. The backpack itself is of good quality and the material doesn't seem to bother my dog. Decent sized pockets. The only problem we have run into is if the backpack isn't packed exactly even weight Wise on each side it will be lop-sided and then it seems to irritate the dog.
customer_reviews.author: Frank H. Gell III

customer_reviews.title: Works for the most part
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the medium size for my 30-35lb pup. All of the measurements make this seem that it would fit my dog perfectly, but the straps are a little too long. So I have to get creative to keep them from dragging on the ground and secured. My dog wears this on our hikes and she doesn't seem to have a problem with it. It's definitely NOT waterproof, so I'll have to eventually buy another one for backpacking so that she can carry her own gear in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: SeattleP

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Dependable
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my German Shepherd! It arrived quickly! I ordered an L, but probably should have sized down. She is only a year, so I am expecting her to grow in to it! The product is well made, and has lots of places for storage. Since she is a puppy we are working on walking on a leash. I was over accidentally choking her when she lunges forward. This product allows for an even distribution among her body, and no more choking!
customer_reviews.author: Lora

customer_reviews.title: Reverse zipper
customer_reviews.text: This works great for our dog. The backpack holds everything we need for a short trip. For longer trips we pack more supplies in another bag and just fill the backpack up until we get to our destination. The only thing we would change is the direction of the zipper. Our sweet pup always gets her nose in the pockets because she smells her food and treats.
customer_reviews.author: CBomb

customer_reviews.title: He likes to wear it and I don’t have to carry my water bottles anymore. Win-win
customer_reviews.text: This actually works really great. Fit is fantastic and stays in place. I have a standard poodle and the medium was almost too big. He likes to wear it and I don’t have to carry my water bottles anymore. Win-win
customer_reviews.author: stinkybeegirl

customer_reviews.title: Would NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Great concept but horrible durability! I received this on November 16, 2019 and by November 20, 2019 it already started to tear below one of the pouches. These are obviously supposed to be used for hiking or doing long trails, so you’d expect it to last a little longer than just under a week. Already started the return process. Would recommend going with another product that actually lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Bret R

customer_reviews.title: If you're in the fence about sizing, I would go smaller. See photos
customer_reviews.text: Great product. My only complaint is the sizing. I got a large for my 55 lb lab/terrier mix, based on the reviews and size descriptions, but I should have gotten a medium. It still works well, I just have to tighten the straps down fairly far so there is a lot of extra slack. The durability seems good so far. My dog can pull on hikes when he gets excited, but I haven't noticed any damage to the pack yet. If you're in the fence about sizing, I would go smaller. See photos.
customer_reviews.author: Aly Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Great pack!
customer_reviews.text: I checked through several backpacks and weighing my pros and cons. I am happy I chose this one because it has a front clip for non pulling with the leash. The material is very sturdy and I know my almost 100lb German Shepard should work just fine with this pack. I also like there was less surface area so my dog wouldn’t get hot with the pack on in the summer. I wish there were more color options but the bright colors help with visibility with a black dog.
customer_reviews.author: LineLine_17

customer_reviews.title: Size chart in description does not match product packaging chart
customer_reviews.text: The pack itself seems pretty sturdy however in measuring my pitbull, he measured 28" girth. The product size chart in the description (as of writing) said a large would fit best. He is not a large dog, but I was going by the chart. It arrived today and the size chart on the packaging says he should be in a medium - totally different size chart from the Amazon description. It us packed in a way that I cannot put it on him and double check. I wish I had gone with my gut and just ordered the medium!
customer_reviews.author: TL Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Had to get a replacement to be happy
customer_reviews.text: The zippers are junk! Right from the get go. Otherwise it would have been great :-( Update: I sent back for an exchange and the new one has all functioning zippers. It did however take a phone call to Amazon bc the package never wanted to arrive. Took about 2 days originally then the replacement took like almost 2 weeks I think.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Spino

customer_reviews.title: Okay for the cost
customer_reviews.text: I want to love this pack, but I found it to be lacking. We went on a 2 mile hike, I measured as directed but the pack was still too big, it shifted & moved a lot while walking and caused imbalance when going uphill. The ring for a leash came off multiple times I had to finally wrap my leash around the handle instead of using the ring and two zipper pulls came off. However, the stitching is sturdy and the pockets are perfect. We had a great hike regardless!
customer_reviews.author: scooter

customer_reviews.title: Hated it and retuning
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited for this harness. Unfortunately I absolutely hated it. Tried with my puppy for one walk, and I will be returning it. First problem is the ring that attaches to the leash is on the back part of the harness meaning no control. I admit I have a puppy, who is still learning to walk 🚶 on a leash, but with our other harness he walks really well. Secondly, if the bags are not perfectly balanced they slide to one side.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Baakko

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I like th I backpack a lot. It has nice size pockets to add weight or carry your thing. The bright green color is great because we do a lot of road walking (I live in the country). What I dont like too much is the adjustable plastic clips. No matter how many times I adjust them within a half hour I need to readjust because they became loose. Other than that this is a great little backpack for the money
customer_reviews.author: D. Bartels

customer_reviews.title: Not for long hikes
customer_reviews.text: I liked the idea of removing the back and having the harness but my poor pup got bad rubbing and burn after 13 miles from the straps and the weight needs to be perfectly even in the two sides for it not to tilt. the way it attaches with just one velcro on each side is not enough. Prob good for small walks but why would need such big bag for that?? Not good for backpacking
customer_reviews.author: JGF

customer_reviews.title: My dog doesn't really like this thing, but I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for Hugo when we go hiking. I have him carry a bottle of water on each side, his treats, and his collapsible bowls. This backpack is surprisingly strong. There have been many instances already where I have had to lift him using the handle (and my dog isn't light). My dog seems to hate this thing, but he still walks with it on. It does seem to rub uncomfortably, so far it has just left red marks, and I will need to look into attaching some padding. I have a hard time keeping it tight though, and it tends to always fall to one side.
customer_reviews.author: Miya

customer_reviews.title: Great pack for the money
customer_reviews.text: My border collie Sue can carry three days of food, a liter of water in a collapsible bag, a themarest z-seat across the handle, and two bowls in her pack. There was a little getting used to, but it doesn't slow her down any. She's still running like a freak through the woods. Complaints of the pack not staying balanced are indeed fair, but it doesn't seem to bother the dog. Additionally, it doesn't get wildly lopsided, just hangs a little to one side.
customer_reviews.author: Mia GulanTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: This is the one
customer_reviews.text: Dog took to it without fuss. Well made, looks cool and will hold some dog treats, extra face masks hand sanitizer, first aid kit and a couple bottles of water or beer, depending on your dogs taste. Buy it..
customer_reviews.author: Chad G. Norton

customer_reviews.title: Nice dog pack for the price
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of this, however I with the straps had the option of being soft and stretchy as a dog who has thin skin does cause some rubbing. This also shifts from one side if the weight is not distributed evenly, or if you dog has a slightly off gate to it's step. Overall you can add fuzzies to the straps and there is a lot of room in those pouches.
customer_reviews.author: Candace

customer_reviews.title: Slow down that antsy dog with a backpack for walks
customer_reviews.text: Good product! Made of decent, fairly durable nylon (I think) and reasonably easy to fit onto my dog - a 5 month old German Shepherd with an abundance of energy... this pack is training him to focus on a real job while walking - something to focus on instead of being distracted by people and traffic or a stray cat. The pack fits nicely and its size is just what the ad said. The side pouches are big enough to carry for 1/2 liter bottles of water with more room for snacks or what have you...
customer_reviews.author: pow141

customer_reviews.title: Great for workout walks and long days at the park!
customer_reviews.text: My GSD wears this to carry his own water bottles on long walks and we attach his collapsible bowl to the back. Really helps to get him a work out and to bring plenty of water where we other wise would have to lug a big back pack. Fits keys, wallets, phones, snacks, and bags very well when not carrying water. People in the park often comment on what a good idea it is to put the dog to work!
customer_reviews.author: SessionWolf

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Cheap quality product. Leash attachment broke apart after my 70lbs puppy pulled on it while we were hiking. Then I attached leash to the handle so I could make my way back to the car, but handle broke apart. Even if you don't plan on using it with a leash, it is still poor quality and construction so not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I've put this on my Boxer dog and put 1 water bottle on each side. Before the backpack he was pulling and was getting startled easily. With training and a HUGE help to the backpack he doesn't pull as much, listens a lot better, and he has been gaining some muscle around his shoulder area. It makes him tired easily so my suggestion is to start off with only 15 min when adding some type of weight.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: It needs to come with instructions on how to use it.
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned to use it at first because my dog pulls me when he has a harness on. The difference with this dog pack and a regular harness is the hook is far enough back that he can't reach the leash to bite it when he sees a cat or rabbit. He did not pull me. I have used the pack twice but haven't put anything in it yet because I want him to get use to it first. I was going to put a bottle of water on each side but it felt a little heavy. That would have been the 2nd time he wore it. It's another W.I.P. (work in progress) with my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Lesley

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the quality of this item. I ordered it to make my daily doggie walks more strenuous for my very high energy, 55 pounds-of-solid-muscle pitbull mix. I use a 2 pound weight and a half liter bottle of water in each pouch which amounts to a little over 10% of her body weight. This way, when we are finished with our neighborhood, she is tuckered out. Even though she is at the high end of the weight range in the product description, the fit is good and the adjustable straps still have a fair amount of space for a pooch that is even larger than her. It serves my purpose well.
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn Hammond

customer_reviews.title: Measure your dogs chest around before ordering one so you get the right size!
customer_reviews.text: Love this pack! I got this for my 90lb pitbull to be able to carry all our things while we went on hikes and walks. Lots of pockets inside and out to hold all your items! I carry 4 bottles of water and all my personal items in it. My dog LOVES to have this pack on and fits him great. I ordered the largest size and it also fits my other 60lb pit as well but I have to tighten it almost all the way around his hip area but I can still use it for both dogs. No tears or rips yet.
customer_reviews.author: zeus

customer_reviews.title: Excellent addition
customer_reviews.text: Just went on a 15+ mile backpacking trip with my cattle dog. She wore this and it worked great! Tough material for a little bush whacking, expandable panniers, reflective detail, and nice small exterior pockets for poop bags and the like. It held up great and she was comfortable. The ultimate satisfaction came when an aggressive dog passed us on trail and I physically picked up my dog by the pack strap and carried her (50 lb) butt up the trail to bypass the other dog. It balanced well, felt sturdy, and she seemed to be comfy enough (no obvious pinching from straps). Happy dog Mom, will use again.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Camping/hiking accessory for your dog
customer_reviews.text: Can't wait to go hiking and camping now! This is bigger (roomier) than I expected. Fits my dog great and was easy to adjust. For reference my shepherd/pitt mix is about 64 lbs. He was excited about it too and actually stood patiently as we put it on him...but I suspect that's because he was thinking about how many treats he can fit in there lol.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Had to send back
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this pack but one of the zippers is stuck open so I have to return it. The plastic bag was already ripped open on arrival so perhaps someone had already sent this unit back. Otherwise it seemed like a nice pack and I liked that the saddle bags were expandable on the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Edmonds

customer_reviews.title: He gets so excited whenever he sees it because he knows we're going out to have fun. The pockets are quite roomy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this so my cocker spaniel can carry most of the gear he needs for a day of adventure(collapsible bowls, treats, bags, ball, etc.). He gets so excited whenever he sees it because he knows we're going out to have fun. The pockets are quite roomy, but be sure not to overload them and make certain that the weight is properly balanced. The carry handle and D-ring are also quite nice. Overall, the backpack is very well constructed and feels like it will last quite some time. Adjusting the fit is quite easy as well. I would absolutely recommend this item to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Barber

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if your dog pulls.
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Fit 20oz water bottles, a collapsible dish, and treats Con: Lasted 5 minutes. I have a young dog and she doesn't have good leash manners yet. We didn't even make it to the trail from the car and the metal clip for the leash opened up. It's not welded closed to a solid ring. It was the beginning of the hike so I left it on the side of the road and carried all her stuff on the hike. It was still there on the hike out so I brought it home and returned it. Luckily it didn't break when we were near a busy street or other dogs.
customer_reviews.author: HJW

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, durable and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: We have Lotus and Luna carry their own food and water on hikes. They love it! Lotus is older and doesn’t have the same stamina as Luna so we tried taking hers off halfway through the hike to give her a break and she cried and begged to put it back on. They are great for long hikes and/or backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Lotus & Luna

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stay centered on my Pup.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this, but I can't get it to stay centered on my Pup even when trying to weight it evenly on both sides. I have tried changing the way I connect the straps, but that didn't work either. I contacted the company to see if there was something I should do differently and they said weighting it evenly on both sides should work. I still use it, but am constantly resituating it on my Pup. My Pup weighs 65 pounds and I bought a large. Fit is good.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia Shearer

customer_reviews.title: I'm very disappointed with this item
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed with this item. It came damaged. Sadly, I didn't notice the damage until after the return period ended. That is on me and I get that but the product is damaged and I'm out that money! That stinks. Too short a return period. My puppy wasn't big enough for it and now that she is, I tried it on her and one strap is ripped. Check it as soon as you get it is my recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix, AZ

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but slips around
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, cute but the buckles don't hold well and if the weight of whatever is in the pockets is at all uneven the bas slip to one side. I ended up using my dongs regular harness for security with the leash and putting these on top but the slipping is disappointing
customer_reviews.author: JessMN

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stay put and prolly works better on smaller dogs
customer_reviews.text: Load needs to be balanced otherwise the pack flops off to one side even when tightened as much as possible. My black lab is a puller/poor walker so I don't blame the pack, but she pulled the D ring for the leash out fairly quick. Im gifting this to a friend with a smaller dog.
customer_reviews.author: bbentley10

customer_reviews.title: Fashionable and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Love this!! I wasn't a fan of the neon/bright colored backpacks and I'm glad I found this one. It looks great on our pup and now he can hold his own water and poop when we're on a hike!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Kelly

customer_reviews.title: It fits the bill
customer_reviews.text: It seems comfortable for the pooch. It doesn’t slide from side to side. Durable. The only thing we don’t like is you have to put the pack over the dogs head to get it on, and then get a paw through another part. It’s a good basic pack.
customer_reviews.author: JenniferK.

customer_reviews.title: Owner and Dog approved- two paws up!
customer_reviews.text: First of all this is much bigger than I had expected and it's got more areas to put things than I thought as well. My dog tried to shake it off for a minute or two, and then was completely comfortable in it. Little accessory items like this really add to the fun of hiking and camping. It's such a cool product. I got the large- my dog is 60lbs. You can see in the picture how happy she is. It is light weight and breathable. So far so good. Can't wait to hit the trails!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can’t make it fit my dog well
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to work but after many trials and adjustments it just doesn’t work for us. It slides from side to side. If I tighten it any further it’s going to slice my poor dog in two. I tried adding weight in the pouches but it’s just a no-go.
customer_reviews.author: Jo VM

customer_reviews.title: Not good for small dogs
customer_reviews.text: Should have a video giving you showing you options on how to put this on . I have two minpin doxi pins and the small is way too big and so much material and confusing on how to use the straps ! Then moved it to our Doxiepin which had longer body ... still so much material and stroll trying to figure it out on how to use and hide Long strains . It’s like a puzzle 🧩!
customer_reviews.author: The Hair Whisperer

customer_reviews.title: Great trail and running backpack!
customer_reviews.text: I got the small/medium size after reading reviews and it works great for my 35lb Aussie mix. She's 9 months old and even when she's full grown at 40ish pounds it will definitely fit her still. I had a bulkier backpack that moved far too much when running with her. This one is lighter weight and fits closer to her body so the pockets aren't flopping around. It holds some stuff but definitely not a ton so it you're truly backpacking with a dog you might get one with bigger pockets. Otherwise this works great for day hikes and running. I usually balance both sides equally so I haven't had a problem with it falling to the sides.
customer_reviews.author: Kyla.R.

customer_reviews.title: Good product, worth the price !
customer_reviews.text: Just like everyone else said, it 'rolls' to the side as the dog walks, just because of gravity. It doesn't matter if the sides are 'balanced' with gear, it just moves. But, it's way worth the effort to move it back up on the dog's back every 10 minutes or so. My lab (not known for his brains) didn't even notice this pack that I filled with food, treats and water for a 4-hour hike. Gave it 4 stars just due to 'rolling'.
customer_reviews.author: Kentucky Jack

customer_reviews.title: Lovely little day pack
customer_reviews.text: This pack was simple to adjust, and easy to fill. It fit well on my dog, and looked really good. The large handle on the top is great for holding her if I haven't attached her leash yet, and the ring for the leash is huge, so it's easy to clip multiple things on it, or just quickly attach the leash without fighting a tiny ring. For the first walk, I put 5 pounds in my 70 pound german shepherds pack, we walked a little under a mile, and she was absolutely pooped afterwards. This pack has helped me train her to walk alongside me without a leash, which is another huge plus.
customer_reviews.author: LISA A BROWN

customer_reviews.title: We tried it on to see if we liked it, we didn't
customer_reviews.text: You have to keep both sides equal in weight otherwise it will flop towards the heavier side. We put a water bottle on one side and a bowl, treats and poop bags on the other and it kept rolling off the side of our dog. We tried multiple adjustments, tighter, or looser, but the results were the same. Also, when we got it was damaged, already had been used and obviously chewed. We tried it on to see if we liked it, we didn't. Waiting on our return.
customer_reviews.author: Granger Hokie

customer_reviews.title: Not for small-medium dogs
customer_reviews.text: The sizing guide said it could fit my dog who was on the smaller side of the spectrum. I had to make adjustments by hand for it to fit. It also looks bad on dogs who are on the smaller side of the sizing spectrum. It was meant to look good on larger dogs.
customer_reviews.author: fannylovewonder

customer_reviews.title: Great dog backpack
customer_reviews.text: Got this for hiking with my dog as well as a bug out bag for emergency prep. Wow, the bag is very spacious! My only complaint would be that there is very little padding where the pack rests against my dog's body. This should be great for small hikes, already have tested it with walks and works great.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: D ring broke immediately
customer_reviews.text: If your dog pulls at all, you'll want to replace the metal loop on this pack before going out for a walk. First time out and my dog pulled it apart running to jump in the water. Luckily, he came back and we were able to make it the rest of our hike with his leash around the handle. Hopefully stitching holds up as I've replaced it with a heavy duty carabiner from the hardware store. The pack also has to be perfectly balanced or it slips down to one side.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Looks pretty but weak stitching.
customer_reviews.text: I got this yesterday an was taking my dog out with it for the second time when he pulled on it so had the back D-ring the leash attaches to pops out an he runs off. I think the pockets are pretty neat an seem sturdy enough but the critical failure so recently after buying it is a major disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great vest
customer_reviews.text: I have a 45 lb American Staffordshire Terrier that this fits perfectly. I put a water bottle in each side plus a baggie of snacks and a collapsible water dish. I read somewhere that it wears dogs out more if you give them a vest since they feel like they are doing a job. Don't know if that's true but my dog enjoys putting on the vest since she knows we are going for a long walk.
customer_reviews.author: Pete M

customer_reviews.title: We went on some pretty extensive hikes/backpacking trips in the catskills and adirondacks
customer_reviews.text: I was really worried about buying these when I did. There were so many conflicting reviews. I ended up going with two of these for my 80 lb yellow lab and my 90 lb golden retriever. We went on some pretty extensive hikes/backpacking trips in the catskills and adirondacks. No rips or anything, and they hit plenty of rocks/trees with them! I filled each side of the pouch with 3 regular poland spring bottles, no problems. I did have to stop occasionally to re-adjust the straps and make sure the sack wasn't lopsided on the dogs.
customer_reviews.author: dennis pryor

customer_reviews.title: Great pack and very functional!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 38 pound Australian shepherd. I chose a medium and if fit her fairly well. She wore it for the first time on our 3 day backpacking trip and was running and jumping around- after the initial shock of wearing a pack wore off- she didn't notice it. We used it to pack her dog food,bowl and bendable frisbee and it all fit well. And that was without opening the second zipper to expand the bags. I would recommend it for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Madison D

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of adding a couple of water bottles to tire my high energy pup on his walk but the ring that you hook the leash to has come off of the backpack twice now. My pup only weighs 55 pounds and you would think the ring would be constructed better. Also, the zippers are always slightly opening half way through our walk and the straps are constantly loosening. I will continue to use the backpack for adding some weight but will use a collar for his leash just to be safe. If I had not been paying attention he could have bolted when that ring let go.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 5 rescue dogs

customer_reviews.title: Leash ring came off and my dog almost died.
customer_reviews.text: The D ring on my pack where you clip the leash actually came off on maybe the third use leaving me holding a limp leash as my dog ran off into the sunset. It isn't even a closed ring, the metal has a gap in it from the factory. Before that on maybe the second use, the chest straps rubbed on my dogs skin so bad she bled after a couple miles. There is no padding. Unless you hate your dog, just get a Ruffwear pack. The three off brand ones I tried before finally just getting the real deal costs basically the same and would have saved my dog unnecessary suffering and danger.
customer_reviews.author: 8===D--

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality, don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: You need to have the same thing in each side (same amount of food, both filled water bottles, etc.) or else it will slide over to one side no matter how much you tighten it. I could live with that, but the first time we took her hiking a BUSH tore a hole in it. That tells me it was never sewn very well, because it was just a bush that tore it, not even branches. Extremely disappointing product, don't buy. It's worth the extra money to buy one from a dependable dealer, I wish I would have.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: The bag was a little large for our dog (40lb ...
customer_reviews.text: The bag was a little large for our dog (40lb Ausstralian Shepherd) - but we were still able to make it work. The bags are a little thin and flimsy, so you can see the outline of anything in the pocket, or when its empty its very awkward, But it does its job.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: Get your own carabiner to replace the D-ring
customer_reviews.text: The pack fits great and I love the additional body strap (I have a large-chested hound with a skinny little butt). The packs on the side have decent space and the expandable zips on the bottom are a good feature as well. However, the D-ring on the pack to attach a lead is extremely flimsy - ours broke on our third hike - see the picture above. Thankfully I had a spare carabiner to replace it with. The webbing itself seems pretty sturdy enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Suggest different brand... cheaply made.  Could have lost my dog at the park!
customer_reviews.text: Not thrilled. Cheap compared to other dog backpacks I bought. First time going hiking yesterday and suddenly the dog wearing this one wasn’t on the leash... turns out the ring just popped off and was gone. The other dog and different backpack still connected and going strong! I’d suggest a different, more study and reliable brand. Luckily my dog who was wearing it is very faithful to me or I could have lost him!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Pooh

customer_reviews.title: Great dog backpack.
customer_reviews.text: I put two regular plastic bottles of water into the pack (one on either side) and strap it on my extremely energetic pitbull. Going for a walk wearing her backpack full of water definitely tuckers her out. It is good quality and I haven't noticed an ripping problems as mentioned in some other reviews. I ordered a medium and it fits my 50lb pitbull perfectly. It seems to be fairly comfortable for her and I haven't noticed it rubbing on her anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Bartee

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price and holds a ton
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pack for our high energy anxious pitbull. He whines on walks if he gets too excited and this has helped give him focus and makes him exert more physical energy. I am glad I got this! I gave it 4 stars because I don't like where the leash clips and I end up having to use the gentle leader harness under this so he doesn't pull as we work on loose leash walking. Great for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Kate B.

customer_reviews.title: Our pup loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Great for long walks. Owners & dog both love packing provisions in it for later. Also has very calming effect on dog while wearing during a storm or over stimulating situations. Highly recommend!!! We have a border collie mix & she loves “working”
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Probably ok for less active dogs.  Mine is an Australian Shepard and sprints everywhere
customer_reviews.text: Works ok. Our dog is off the leash mostly and when he ran a lot it would twist to one side or the other. Tried adjusting the straps and putting equal amounts of weight in both bags but that didn't seem to make much difference. When he was very active it would slide around and get caught on under brush on our hiking trip. Finally just took the bags off and left the vest that seemed to help but the vest doesn't have much storage for dog food, leash etc.
customer_reviews.author: J. R.

customer_reviews.title: This pack slips around on my dog.
customer_reviews.text: There is no way I could keep this pack on my dog. We practiced with it just walking through the neighborhood. This isn't my first rodeo so I knew how to fit it to her body but it just wouldn't work, no matter what. She had one pack riding low on the side, and one pack riding on top of her back. It was a bit comical. The weights were even, just a few pounds on each side. We tried it on a few walks and then I just said no way. Bummer. Back to the drawing board. Amazon doesn't take returns on this item.
customer_reviews.author: healthyfoodlover

customer_reviews.title: Way to small!
customer_reviews.text: Product was to small for my chocolate lab. My dogs girth is a 35 and I could barely get the buckles latched, no breathing room. Disappointed in the sizing, this is not for xL dogs. It did seem like it’d be a nice pack if it actually fit. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Readnswim

customer_reviews.title: I like that they have zipper pockets with interior organization and ...
customer_reviews.text: I am really impressed with this backpack. I started my dog with just the vest portion (which still has two small mesh pockets) and she took right to it. She's an 80lb boxer mix, and the large fits her well. After a week, I reattached the saddle bags. I like that they have zipper pockets with interior organization and outer velcro pockets for easy access. This backpack even took a surprise swim in the river with my dog, and kept the contents fairly dry. Overall, this is much better than what I expected for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Remove back strap from underbelly attachment before use.
customer_reviews.text: At first we hated this pack. We thought it was awfully designed because it left a huge raw mark under the front armpit of our dog, but then we realized that it was our fault because we forgot to take out one of the straps from the underbelly attachment. oops! So forewarning before use: take out the back strap from the underbelly attachment first, then it works great! Has a ton of space to hold things and isn't super bulky on our dog. We got the Large and our dog is a 69lb husky/lab mix. Fits perfectly now.
customer_reviews.author: Leanne H-N

customer_reviews.title: Fit is good.
customer_reviews.text: We havent used it yet, so I'll update after for comfort and durability, but the fit is good. I got sm/m my dog is 44 lbs, it's a lite loose, but he also has short hair.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Jones

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing purchase
customer_reviews.text: Took our dog backpacking and this pack constantly slipped off to one side or another despite how tight the harnesses were. Harness left rash burns where straps underneath rubbed. Back clip broke first day where leash attaches. I ended up taking this off my dog and just putting it in my (already 30lb) backpack because it was so inconvenient. Threw product away as soon as we got home. Don't waste your money on this product. Thoroughly disappointed. I did however, like the expansive side pockets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Large fits 80lb dog with some room to spare.
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure how well this pack would work out but it exceeded my every expectation. My dog is an 80lb German Shepherd Mix and it fits him perfectly (could even fit a slightly bigger dog) ♦ Adjustable straps made it easy to fit. Even when he was running around off leash the pack stayed on straight. ♦ Plenty of Cargo room for his food, collapsible bowls, and bags ♦ Top handle was really useful to control him when being passed on narrow trail sections. ♦ He barely seemed to notice he was wearing it
customer_reviews.author: David Meservey

product_meta.title: Outward Hound, Lightweight Dog Backpack, Hiking Gear for Dogs
product_meta.description:
Style:Daypak| Size:Medium| Color:BlueThe DayPak is a day-tripping dog lovers delight that allows your pup to comfortably carry extra gear and essentials! A light-capacity pack featuring saddlebag-style design, it’s ideal for both quick getaways and everyday errands with your dog. Enjoy the convenience and storage space of 4 expandable pockets—and, when you’re ready to roll, simply attach your pup’s leash directly to the DayPak’s D-ring clip. Explore new ground with Outward Hound Gear! Our high-quality performance gear will keep your pup safely equipped for every new adventure!

*A note about sizing: all pups are unique and special, especially yours! Sizing guidelines may differ dog to dog. Please choose your size after taking every measurement listed on the chart. And take any other unique traits (large shoulders, long torso, etc.) into consideration.
feature_bullets: HIKING HERO: The Outward Hound DayPak is one of our bestselling and most popular dog backpacks. This pack securely holds all of your walking and hiking essentials for more hands-free fun.
MADE FOR MILES: Breathable mesh material encompasses the base of this pack keeping your dog cool and providing for refreshing airflow while you’re on the go.

WHY YOU’LL LOVE IT: You’ll enjoy stowing essentials like keys, id cards, cell phones and doggie bags in these expandable pockets. With less attention to loose items and more focus on the fun, you and your dog will love worry-free walking.

STYLISH AND SAFE: The sleek design of this dog backpack is free from bulk and full of function. Adjustable straps keep the pack in place and reflective piping provide enhanced visibility to your dog day or night.

MADE TO FIT: Not all dog backpacks are created equally. We know that every dog has a different body type and have made the Outward Hound DayPak to fit the smallest and largest of explorers. Available in 2 different colors and 3 sizes, there’s a pack perfect for your furry friend.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
